Authors:
Monika Chandani Dayarathne, Mingkhuan Doilom, Evan B.G.
Jones, Putatak Chomnunti, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Phaeoacremonium rhizophorae sp. nov. from mangroves in
Southern Thailand
Abstract:
A novel mangrove fungus, Phaeoacremonium rhizophorae
collected in Krabi province, Southern Thailand comprises similar
morphological features of the genus Phaeoacremonium (Togniniaceae,
Togniniales). It also forms a phylogenetically well-supported clade with
Phaeoacremonium species, based on ITS sequences. The new taxon is
characterized by having ascomata with relatively long (300380 μm)
conical necks and suballantoid to oblong, slightly curved ascospores
with rounded ends and small guttules at their ends. P. rhizophorae is
significantly different from all the other species of the genus
Phaeoacremonium being saprobic on Rhizophora mucronata. This is the
first record of Phaeoacremonium species form the marine
environment.
